intro: Funkiella versiformis, commonly known as the variable funkiella, is a unique species of aquatic plant belonging to the order Charales. It is characterized by its branching, filamentous thallus that can vary in form depending on environmental conditions. The plant lacks true roots, stems, and leaves, instead consisting of a central axis with lateral branches. It thrives in freshwater environments, often found in slow-moving streams and ponds. Its ecological role includes serving as a habitat for microorganisms and contributing to nutrient cycling in aquatic ecosystems.
